docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Nov. 20--A Soviet scientist reported today on studies indicating that long-duration space travelers would be especially vunerable to disease on their return to earth because they would have lost much of their immunity.

headline.main: Report on Space Dogs Indicates Astronaut Health Peril on Long Flights

docs.abstract: fed is joint sponsor with Internatl Astronautics Acad of conf, Geneva, on space health problems; sessions
docs.snippet: GENEVA, Nov. 20--A Soviet scientist reported today on studies indicating that long-duration space travelers would be especially vunerable to disease on their return to earth because they would have lost much of their immunity.

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: ON a tree-shaded street in Brooklyn, the compact four-story, red-brick building, with its archways and floor-to-ceiling glass windows, is inviting. Inside the glass entrance doors, the reception area resembles a gracious living room, with its multicolored lounge, modern furniture and granite sculptures. A friendly girl at the reception desk welcomes the visitor. One may use the self-operated elevator, or the graceful, central staircase -- innovations that emphasize the casualness, the openness of the place.

headline.main: Street Psychiatry Comes To Brooklyn; An experiment in metal health Street psychiatry comes to Brooklyn "These premises tell the people, 'We love you. Come in.'"

docs.abstract: G Samuels article on operation of Maimonides Mental Health Center, Bklyn, as a community mental health center; cites work of center dirs Drs Ullman and Tarail; illus

docs.lead_paragraph: UNTIL quite recently, most parents of teen - agers were not especially concerned with facts about drug abuse. The use and misuse of new and ancient mind-altering preparations were largely matters of medical, pharmaceutical and, as regards control, legal interest.

headline.main: Before your kid tries drugs; Why do drug-taking kids want to ward off reality?

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 -- A successful step toward an entirely new type of treatment for virus diseases was reported today by scientists here and in New York.

headline.main: A New Treatment For Viruses Tested; NEW TREATMENT TESTED ON VIRUS

docs.abstract: Drs S Baron and J H Park announce successful step toward new type of treatment for virus diseases, article in Science; method works by inducing body to produce large amts of natural antivirus substance, interferon; details
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 -- A successful step toward an entirely new type of treatment for virus diseases was reported today by scientists here and in New York.
